intro: Balanites maughamii subsp. maughamii, commonly known as the African date palm, is a flowering plant in the family Bombacaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Sudan and South Sudan. The plant is characterized by its tall, straight trunk and broad, palm-like leaves. It produces yellowish flowers that develop into woody fruits containing edible seeds. This species is adapted to survive in harsh environments with low rainfall and high temperatures.
